TunableTuple.description: Control which objects are marked as reserved for in use and how. When setting this value, consider these rules: * Sims may never be marked as in use. Do not try to reserve TargetSim, nor you should try to reserve Object if the interaction may run on Sims. * You may not use a 'basic' reservation if you wish to reserve an entire object and that object has parts. In that case, you must use an 'all' reservation. e.g. Sit Sims sit down, and may do so on individual parts of the sofa. Because the interaction targets the part specifically, we use a 'basic' reservation to reserve that and only that part. e.g. Possess Ghosts may possess objects and have them shake. Since they might possess the sofa (in its entirety), we want to use the 'all' reserve type to mark the object, as well as each individual part as reserved for use. This would prevent other Sims from sitting down while the object is being possessed. Note: it is valid to use the 'all' reserve type on any object, not just objects with parts!

TunableVariant.name: reserve_type_for_provided_target
TunableVariant.description: When the interaction is provided a target (instead of discovering them via the ParticipantType), only this is needed. If None, it uses the first Subject List Reserve Type.

TunableTuple.name: all
TunableTuple.description: A basic reservation handler that reserves, exclusively, all parts of an object. Normally, basic reservation handlers do not allow the reservation of objects with parts, as that usually indicates that parts have been mistuned not to support postures or affordances. A valid use case of this reservation type manifests itself when the interaction affects the entirety of an object. For example, a Sim extinguishing a Sofa that's on fire implicitly reserves the entire object and should disallow the reservation of a single part by a Sim who might want to sit down.

TunableTuple.name: basic
TunableTuple.description: A basic reservation handler reserves the target exclusively. No other reservation is allowed while this handler is active.

TunableTuple.name: interlocked
TunableTuple.description: A reservation handler that allows other reservations to be applied.

TunableVariant.name: interlock
TunableVariant.description: Define how this handler interlocks with other reservation handlers.

TunableTuple.name: interaction
TunableTuple.description: The reservation handler is allowed to interlock with reservation handlers owner by specific interactions.

TunableList.name: affordance_whitelist
TunableList.description: The affordances that this reservation handler is compatible with.

TunableTuple.name: multi
TunableTuple.description: A reservation handler that reserves the target, and allows other reservations to be applied (as long as they also allow multiple reservations).

TunableVariant.name: reservation_limit
TunableVariant.description: Specify a limit to the number of reservations allowed on the object.

TunableTuple.name: stat_based
TunableTuple.description: Limit the number of reservations to the value of a statistic on the object. This does not modify the statistic in any way.

Tunable.name: reservation_statistic
Tunable.description: The statistic that drives the number of reservations allowed on the object. If the statistic's value is 3, then any attempt to place a fourth reservation on the object would fail.

TunableTuple.name: multi_reserve_all_unmovable_parts
TunableTuple.description: A Reserve Object Handler that allows multiple reservations but only reserves objects that are not carryable or live draggable. This is a very special case reservation handler used for indirect reservations like tending the espresso bar because interactions may need to reserve objects but can't because they only have a geometric constraint. TunableTuple.name: social_group_exclusive
TunableTuple.description: A Reserve Object Handler that allows a whole social group to reserve an object.

Tunable.name: reserve_immediately
Tunable.description: If enabled, this will cause the target of the reservation to be immediately reserved. This is not usually how reservations are supposed to work and should only be used in very specific cases. Please consult your GPE about this option before enabling it.

TunableList.name: subject_list
TunableList.description: List of reservation handlers and subject pairs. An empty list will result in the default basic reservation type for the default participant types.

TunableTuple.description: Select a reservation handler for a set of subjects. Backward compatibility: Older tuning may have one item where only the reserve_type is used instead of using the Reserve Type For Provided Target.
